moves.1. c4 Nf6 2. g3: I to play unusual style but it effective to get me to current rating.
moves.2... e5 3. Nc3: My goal is protect e4 and attack center with piece instead no with pawn. It not usual teach method but I not average player.
moves.3... Nc6 4. Bg2 Bb4: Counter my plan to defend e4. This typical respond I see from this rated group.
moves.5. Nf3: I to take risk here but I think to push e4 not so good right now.
moves.5... O-O 6. O-O: Both side equal develop but my queen have more mobile. This important detail as game go on.
moves.6... Bxc3: Black prepare to advance the pawn. So he to remove the knight threat first.
moves.7. bxc3 Re8: With no knight I have to find way to defend center or to suffer big lose.
moves.8. d3 e4: This move is early I think but I expect it early in game.
moves.9. Nd4 exd3: I no understand need for this. 2 defender on the pawn and I no plan to take and weaken pawn structure.
moves.10. exd3 h6 11. Bf4: My piece now all mobile thank to my opponent. I think I have a bit of edge here even though my pawn is double on queens side.
moves.11... Nxd4 12. cxd4 d5: Black to open space and try to get other piece involved before I begin to plan attack.
moves.13. Re1 Rxe1+ 14. Qxe1 dxc4: This move I not understand. It win pawns in center but it set up trap that I thought he see. I ask him after the game and he say he not see far enough to calculate trap. But this move begin the end of game.
moves.17. Rd8+ Kh7 18. Qb1+ g6 19. Qa1: To set a strong attack on the black king.
moves.19... Ng8: This move set up a long mate net.

players: Me (1989 USCF) vs. B. Liu (2259 USCF)
